column1: Coronda is a small city in the province of Santa Fe
column2: Argentina. It is located in the San Jerónimo Department
column3: 43 km south from the provincial capital (Santa Fe). It has a population of about 18

column1: The town was founded in 1867 by Governor Nicasio Oroño
column2: and became a city on 6 February 1860.

column1: Its parish church was designed by Carlo Zucchi.
Municipal information: Municipal Affairs Federal Institute (IFAM)
